articles.title: Voyager 1’s Long-Dead Thrusters Fire Again After 20 Years – Just in Time - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Voyager 1’s “dead” thrusters are alive again—another miraculous twist in its legendary journey.
articles.content: NASA’s twin Voyager spacecraft, launched in 1977, are now traveling through interstellar space at around 35,000 mph (56,000 kph). This artist’s concept depicts one of the probes speeding away. Credit… [+7464 chars]

articles.title: Earth’s Secret Hydrogen Jackpot: Enough Clean Power for 170,000 Years - SciTechDaily

articles.content:
